ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.2_0: the monks were bathing in the hot springs.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.3_0: On that occasion King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha wanted to wash his head, and he went to the hot springs.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.4_0: He waited respectfully for the monks to finish, but they kept on bathing until dark.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.5_0: Only then was King Bimbisāra able to wash his head. But because the town gates had been shut, he had to spend the night outside the city. In the morning, with his make-up still on,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.7_0: The Buddha said to him, “Great King, why have you come so early in the morning with your make-up still on?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.8_0: The King told him what had happened.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.9_0: The Buddha then instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.9_1: The King then got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.10_0: Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.11_0: “Is it true, monks, that monks bathed without moderation, even after seeing the King?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.14_0: “... How can those foolish men do this?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.15_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.16_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.17.1_0: ‘If a monk bathes at intervals of less than a half-month, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:1.18_0: The Buddha has laid down a training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.1_0: Soon afterwards, because they were afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not bathe when it was hot or when they had a fever, and they went to sleep covered in sweat.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.2_0: Their robes and the furniture became dirty.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.3_0: They told the Buddha. He then had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.4_0: “Monks, if it’s hot or you have a fever, I allow you to bathe at intervals of less than a half-month.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.5_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.6.1_0: ‘If a monk bathes at intervals of less than a half-month, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.7_1: two-and-a-half-month period of the hot season and the fever season, comprising the last one-and-a-half months of sumer and the first month of the rainy season.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:2.8_0: The Buddha has laid down a training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.1_0: Soon afterwards a number of monks were sick.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.2_0: Soon afterwards the monks asked the sick monks
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.3_0: “I hope you’re bearing up, reverend, I hope you’re getting better?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.4_0: “Previously we bathed at intervals of less than a half-month, and then we were comfortable.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.5_0: But now that the Buddha has prohibited this, we don’t bathe because we’re afraid of wrongdoing. Because of that we’re not comfortable.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.6_0: They told the Buddha. He then had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.7_0: “Monks, I allow a sick monk to bathe at intervals of less than a half-month.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.8_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.9.1_0: ‘If a monk bathes at intervals of less than a half-month, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.10_1: if he is more than two-and-a-half-month period of the hot season and the fever season, comprising the last one-and-a-half months of summer and the first month of the rainy season; he is sick.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:3.11_0: The Buddha has laid down a training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.1_0: Soon afterwards the monks were doing building work, but because they were afraid of wrongdoing they did not bathe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.2_0: When they’ve arrived, they lay down on the furniture.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.3_0: They told the Buddha. He then had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.4_0: “Monks, I allow you to bathe at intervals of less than a half-month when you’re working.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.5_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.6.1_0: ‘If a monk bathes at intervals of less than a half-month, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.7_1: if he is the two-and-a-half-month period of the hot season and the fever season, comprising the last one-and-a-half months of summer and the first month of the rainy season; he is sick; he is working.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:4.8_0: The Buddha has laid down a training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:5.1_0: Soon afterwards the monks were traveling, but because they were afraid of wrongdoing they did not bathe.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:5.4_0: “Monks, I allow you to bathe at intervals of less than a half-month when you’re traveling.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:5.8_0: The Buddha has laid down a training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.1_0: Soon afterwards a number of monks were making robes out in the open, and they were assailed by dusty winds.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.1_1: and the rain pours down on it.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.2_0: But because they were afraid of wrongdoing, they did not bathe afterwards, and they went to sleep while still moist.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.3_0: Their robes and the furniture became dirty.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.4_0: They told the Buddha. He then had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.5_0: “Monks, if there is wind and rain, I allow you to bathe at intervals of less than a half-month.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.6_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.7.1_0: ‘If a monk bathes at intervals of less than a half-month, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:6.8_1: if he is traveling; it is the two-and-a-half-month period of the hot season and the fever season, comprising the last one-and-a-half months of summer and the first month of the rainy season; he is sick; he is working; he is traveling; there is wind and rain.’”

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.4_0: ... The monks who have been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.5_0: At intervals of less than a half-month:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.8_0: if he bathes with bath powder or soap, then for every effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.9_0: When the bath is finished, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.15_0: the first month of the rainy season. During the two-and-a-half-month period of the hot season and the fever season, he may bathe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.17_0: he should not bathe without bathing.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.19_0: even if he just has been appointed, he may bathe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.21_0: if he intends to travel at least six kilometers, he may bathe.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.1.23_1: If he has rained on all sides, he may bathe.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc57:7.3.7_0: They burn in times of trouble,
